descriptionOfCourse:
Gitvc
This course contains three parts that will allow you to learn the basics of working with git:
Committing Changes
================

,In this scenario, we will answer questions such as:
 * How to view changes in the working directory?
 
 * How to commit changes to your repository?
Committing files
================

In this scenario,you will learn how to initialize a new repository _Git_ and commit files in the version control system.

Version control allows you to write changes to a file or set of files over time, which allows you to revert to a specific version if necessary. _Git_ is a distributed version control system, which means
relations of the locations of elements play a significant role in terms of the functioning of the system.
This means that instead
snapshot of the latest files you have a full storage mirror on your local computer. The repository tracks changes when they occurred and by whom.

 For more information about installing _Git_, you can refer to *[the official documentation] (https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Instal..)*.
#Using Branches
Here you will learn how to create branches in your repository.
The branch allows you to work effectively in a completely new working directory.
As a result, in one repository ** _ Git _ ** there may be several different versions of the code base,
each of which can be switched without changing directories.

The default branch in ** _ Git _ ** is called `` master``. Additional branches allow you to perform the same operations and commands,
as on the master, such as committing, merging, and submitting changes.
Since additional branches work just like master, they are ideal for prototyping and
 experiments, as any changes can be combined with master if necessary.
